types.name: Appointment
types.description:
Appointments represent a planned or past meeting between a patient and a practitioner. This is based
on https://www.hl7.org/fhir/appointment.html
As part of the integration flow, Mirah will work out whether this appointments needs an accompanying measurement
encounter and automatically create one as appropriate. Mirah's ETL will generally make a best effort to estimate
where and what context the measurement should be taken. The more information (Episode of Care, Organization,
etc) that you supply, the more likely it is to be correct.
Note that as part of this processing, Mirah may immediately choose to create assessments and trigger
communications with the patient or other participants, for example by text message or email.
In order to keep adherence statistics up to date, Mirah also requires that updates on past
appointments are sent, so that we can calculate whether e.g. the appointment was a no-show.

fields.name: careEpisode
fields.description: The episode of care this appointment is part of

fields.name: endDate
fields.description: End time.

fields.name: externalId
fields.description:
The system's best guess at the external identifer provided by this user. In the case of there being multiple
systems of record this may not be 100% accurate. If this object has multiple identifiers from the same system
of record, e.g. if patients have been deduplicated on our side, this will only return the first. You should
use the `identifier` columnn to get all identifiers.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The full list of the appointment's external identifiers

fields.name: measurementEncounter
fields.description: The measurement encounter this appointment is associated with

fields.name: minutesDuration
fields.description: The duration of this appointment in minutes.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: The organization for this appointment, if known

fields.name: patient
fields.description: The patient for this appointment

fields.name: practitioner
fields.description: The practitioner for this appointment, if known

fields.name: startDate
fields.description: Start time. required unless canceled.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this appointment

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: CareEpisode
types.description:
Episodes of Care represent an active course of treatment for a patient in a particular organization
and with a particular care team. This resource is based on the FHIR specification:
https://www.hl7.org/fhir/episodeofcare.html.

Measurements inside the Mirah platform will typically occur inside the same episode of care as the
treating organization, but Mirah's encounters, centered around measurement, will not necessarily be
related to direct encounters with practitioners from the treating organization. For example, in cases
where Mirah is doing a follow-up assessment, there may be no physical encounter present.

Episodes of care also form the basis for attaching extra clinical information like diagnoses
or treatment modalities, and form the natural level to ask treatment-level analytics questions such as
'how is treatment progressing'.

Patients may have multiple episodes of care active at any one time, but are typically limited to one active
episode of care per organization.

fields.name: encounters
fields.description: Mirah measurements for this care episode

types.name: DiagnosticCode
types.description:
Diagnostic codes represent diagnoses available in your system. These have both a name and a code. For our
purposes these are effectively just names and tags, but they usually correspond to codesets such as
ICD 10 or SNOMED.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The code for this diagnostic code

fields.name: externalId
fields.description:
The system's best guess at the external identifer provided by this user. In the case of there being multiple
systems of record this may not be 100% accurate. If this object has multiple identifiers from the same system
of record, e.g. if patients have been deduplicated on our side, this will only return the first. You should
use the `identifier` columnn to get all identifiers.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The full list of the episode of care's external identifiers

fields.name: name
fields.description: The displayable name for this diagnostic code

fields.name: patientConditions
fields.description: Patient conditions for this diagnosis

types.description:
Diagnostic Reports are the core resource that links to results of assessments, as found in the accompanying
Observation records.

fields.name: encounter

fields.name: observations

types.name: DiagnosticReportStatus
types.description: The status of a diagnostic report, as defined by https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-diagnostic-report-status.html

enumValues.name: REGISTERED
enumValues.description: The report has been created but no data has been entered

enumValues.name: PARTIAL
enumValues.description: The report has had data populated but is incomplete

types.name: Encounter
types.description:
Encounters represent the process of gathering a single measurement. This encompasses the practitioner viewing
the report and using it to inform treatment, which is why it does not make sense for the measurement to be
represented as a Diagnostic Report.

This resource is currently read only. There is no way to directly create a measurement encounter, instead
you must send appointment information which the Mirah engine will automatically turn into measurement
encounter according to business rules.

fields.name: careEpisode
fields.description: The episode of care the encounter takes place in

fields.name: diagnosticReport
fields.description: The diagnostic report, if available

fields.name: measurementInvitations
fields.description:
Each Mirah measurement encounter can made up of multiple invitations for responses from different respondents
at different times.

fields.name: mirahStatus
fields.description: The internal status of this encounter. This does not have a 1:1 correspondence with the FHIR encounter status as there are multiple different failure statuses, for example the patient canceling their appointment may lead to the measurement opportunity being closed, while the practitioner not viewing an active feedback report leads to another.

fields.name: patient
fields.description: The encounter's subject

fields.name: periodEnd
fields.description: The end date of this measurement. Note that Mirah measurements are currently considered to be instantaneous so period end is always the same as period end. This may change in the future

fields.name: periodStart
fields.description: The start date of this measurement. Note that Mirah measurements are currently considered to be instantaneous so period end is always the same as period start. This may change in the future

fields.name: practitioner
fields.description: The encounter's primary practitioner

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

enumValues.name: PERIOD_START
enumValues.description: The start period of the measurement

enumValues.name: PERIOD_END
enumValues.description: The end period of the measurement

types.name: EncounterStatus
types.description:
Encounter status type represents the complete workflow of a measurement, from scheduled, through having
notifications sent, to beeing completed by respondents, to being viewed by the provider and used to inform
care.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: An appointment is present but no notifications have been sent

enumValues.name: AWAITING_ASSESSMENT
enumValues.description: Notifications have been sent and we are waiting for input

enumValues.name: FEEDBACK_AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: At least one participant has started and there is data available

enumValues.name: REPORT_PREVIEWED
enumValues.description: UNUSED: The report has been previewed but not fully viewed

enumValues.name: REPORT_VIEWED
enumValues.description: The report has been viewed but not all feedback has been gathered yet

enumValues.name: NOSHOW
enumValues.description: The appointment attached to the session was a noshow

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The measurement has been canceled and is not necessary

enumValues.name: COMPLETE
enumValues.description: The report is complete and has been viewed by the provider

enumValues.name: CLOSED
enumValues.description: The measurement was not taken by the participant

types.name: Float
types.description: Represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

enumValues.name: NON_BINARY
enumValues.description: The patient identifies with neither/both female and male

enumValues.name: TRANSGENDER_MALE
enumValues.description: The patient identifies as transgender female-to-male

enumValues.name: TRANSGENDER_FEMALE
enumValues.description: The patient identifies as transgender male-to-female

enumValues.name: NON_DISCLOSE
enumValues.description: The patient does not wish to disclose his gender identity

types.name: ID
types.description: Represents a unique identifier that is Base64 obfuscated. It is often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"VXNlci0xMA=="`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Identifier
types.description: An identifier from an external system

fields.name: assigner
fields.description: The system of record that assigned this value

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value assigned by the system of record

types.name: ImportResult
types.description: Displays the status of the attempt to create or update a row in the system

enumValues.name: UPDATED
enumValues.description: A an existing row was updated

enumValues.name: SKIPPED
enumValues.description: The row was understood but the system decided not to process it

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error when processing the row

types.name: Int
types.description: Represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: MeasurementInvitation
types.description:
Measurement Invitations represent a non-FHIR object that shows when we expect to gather measurement information
from a given participant.

fields.name: closesAt
fields.description: When this invitation closes for feedback. No responses will be allowed after this date.

fields.name: encounter
fields.description: The measurement encounter this invitation is part of

fields.name: lastNotificationDate
fields.description: The date of the last notification to be sent.

fields.name: notificationStatus
fields.description: The status of the notifications on this invitation

fields.name: opensAt
fields.description: When this invitation opens for feedback. No responses will be allowed before this date.

fields.name: phase
fields.description: The phase of measurement this invitation is part of

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this invitation

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: MeasurementInvitationNotificationStatus
types.description: The status of notifications for an invitation.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: Notifications will be sent and are scheduled

enumValues.name: FORBIDDEN
enumValues.description: The respondent has turned off notifications and none will be sent

enumValues.name: MISSING_DETAILS
enumValues.description: There are insufficient contact details to send notifications

enumValues.name: NOT_NEEDED
enumValues.description: No notifications were required for this invitation.

types.name: MeasurementInvitationPhase
types.description: The phase of a measurement, i.e. before, during or after the target date.

types.name: MeasurementInvitationStatus
types.description:
The status of an invitation to measurement. This is not a standard FHIR resource but instead forms part of
Mirah's custom measurement system.

enumValues.name: FUTURE
enumValues.description: The invitation is for the future and cannot be used yet

enumValues.name: NEW
enumValues.description: The invitation is open but is not configured to send any notifications

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: The invitation is open for feedback and notifications are scheduled

enumValues.name: SENT
enumValues.description: The invitation is open for feedback and notification have been sent

enumValues.name: BEGUN
enumValues.description: The invitation has been started by the participant

enumValues.name: COMPLETE
enumValues.description: The invitation has been completed by the participant

enumValues.name: LOCKED_OUT
enumValues.description: The invitation has been locked due to failed login attempts.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The invitation was not started and has expired

enumValues.name: PARTIAL
enumValues.description: The invitation was started but not completed and has now expired

fields.name: createOrUpdateAppointment
fields.description:
Create or update a appointment. The only required field is externalId. All other fields are optional to
allow partial updates. If you attempt to create a appointment that does not already exist, and do not supply
sufficient fields, the create will fail. For this patient, startDate and status are considered required.

args.name: input
args.description: Parameters for CreateOrUpdateAppointment

fields.name: createOrUpdateDiagnosticCode
fields.description:
Create or update a diagnostic code, e.g. for ICD10. The only required field is externalId.
All other fields are optional to allow partial updates. If you attempt to create a code that does not already 
exist, and do not supply sufficient fields, the create will fail.

args.name: input
args.description: Parameters for CreateOrUpdateDiagnosticCode

fields.name: createOrUpdateOrganization
fields.description:
Create or update a organization. The only required field is externalId. All other fields are optional to
allow partial updates. If you attempt to create a organization that does not already exist, and do not supply
sufficient fields, the create will fail. For this purpose, name is a required field.

args.name: input
args.description: Parameters for CreateOrUpdateOrganization

fields.name: createOrUpdatePatient
fields.description:
Create or update a patient. The only required field is externalId. All other fields are optional to
allow partial updates. If you attempt to create a patient that does not already exist, and do not supply
sufficient fields, the create will fail. For this purpose, birthDate, givenName and familyName are also
required fields.

args.name: input
args.description: Parameters for CreateOrUpdatePatient

fields.name: createOrUpdatePatientCondition
fields.description:
Create or update a patient diagnosis. The diagnosis status code should have been created previously via
CreateOrUpdateDiagnosticCode. The only required field is externalId.
All other fields are optional to allow partial updates. If you attempt to create a code that does not already 
exist, and do not supply sufficient fields, the create will fail.

args.name: input
args.description: Parameters for CreateOrUpdatePatientCondition

fields.name: createOrUpdatePractitioner
fields.description:
Create or update a practitioner. The only required field is externalId. All other fields are optional to
allow partial updates. If you attempt to create a practitioner that does not already exist, and do not supply
sufficient fields, the create will fail. For this email, givenName, familyName are required fields.

args.name: input
args.description: Parameters for CreateOrUpdatePractitioner

types.name: Observation
types.description:
Observations represent the scored, summary result of a psychological assessment. For example,
the summary score and interpretation of the PHQ-9 questionnaire. A single assessment may have
multiple observations, if that questionnaire contains multiple subscales, or has been completed
by multiple performers.

fields.name: diagnosticReport
fields.description: The diagnostic report this observation is part of.

fields.name: interpretation
fields.description: A per-questionnaire interpretation of the score. Usually conforms to "high" "medium", etc, but can vary on a per-scale basis.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The answers this observation was scored from.

fields.name: performerType
fields.description: The role of the person performing the observation. This is usually the respondent on the questionnaire. For questionnaires where the scoring is a combination of respondents, this may be null.

fields.name: questionnaire
fields.description:
The questionnaire this observation corresponds to. This is usually the same as that provided by the
Questionnaire Response, but in the cases where the observation is a subscale of the questionnaire response,
the questionnaire response will be blank.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The observation's name

fields.name: value
fields.description: The computed value of this observation. May be null if the value could not be computed

fields.name: valueSystem
fields.description: The system which this value is calculated under. This is typically either "raw" or "normed" but may be different for other questionnaires

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: Organization
types.description:
Organizations in the Mirah system currently represent a hierarchy of units/facilities
requiring either different treatment configurations (e.g. inpatient facilities require different
measurement protocols to outpatient) or useful for the purpose of analytics. It is roughly based on
https://www.hl7.org/fhir/organization.html

fields.name: externalId
fields.description:
The system's best guess at the external identifer provided by this user. In the case of there being multiple
systems of record this may not be 100% accurate. If this object has multiple identifiers from the same system
of record, e.g. if patients have been deduplicated on our side, this will only return the first. You should
use the `identifier` columnn to get all identifiers.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The full list of the organization's external identifiers

fields.name: name
fields.description: The organization's name

fields.name: partOf
fields.description: The organization's parent

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: Patient
types.description:
Patients represent people who are in treatment. They can have appointments, and be the target of assessments.
Patients are only treated in the context of an episode of care.

fields.name: birthDate
fields.description: The patient's date of birth.

fields.name: careEpisodes
fields.description: Care episodes for this patient

fields.name: managingOrganization
fields.description:
The managing organization for this patient record. This is used most commonly in situations where there are
data firewalls between organizations and the patient is not in active treatment. In this case, managing
 organization can be used to show who has access to the patient record.

fields.name: mrn
fields.description: The medical record number (MRN) of the patient. This should be specified only if a human readable number in use by clinicians. Backend database system identifiers should not be provided.

fields.name: patientConditions
fields.description: Conditions for this patient

types.name: PatientCondition
types.description: A diagnostic code applied to a patient. See https://www.hl7.org/fhir/condition.html

fields.name: diagnosticCode

fields.name: externalId
fields.description:
The system's best guess at the external identifer provided by this user. In the case of there being multiple
systems of record this may not be 100% accurate. If this object has multiple identifiers from the same system
of record, e.g. if patients have been deduplicated on our side, this will only return the first. You should
use the `identifier` columnn to get all identifiers.

fields.description: The full list of the episode of care's external identifiers

See https://www.hl7.org/fhir/practitioner.html for more details.

The system's best guess at the external identifer provided by this user. In the case of there being multiple
systems of record this may not be 100% accurate. If this object has multiple identifiers from the same system
of record, e.g. if patients have been deduplicated on our side, this will only return the first. You should
use the `identifier` columnn to get all identifiers.

types.name: PractitionerRole

FHIR PractitionerRoles represent the services provided by a given practitioner in a given organizational
context. See https://www.hl7.org/fhir/practitionerrole.html for more details.

types.name: Questionnaire
types.description:
Questionnaires represent assessments. Most of these are validated psychological instruments but this may also
include other instruments such as satification surveys.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The questionnaire's description

fields.name: items
fields.description: The items used in this questionnaire

fields.name: mirahMnemonic
fields.description: A unique Mirah string used to identity the scales in a human readable way

fields.name: name
fields.description: The questionnaire's name

fields.name: parentQuestionnaire
fields.description: The parent of this questionnaire

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: QuestionnaireItem
types.description:
Questionnaire items represent questions for a given assessment. Each question may be used by multiple
different assessments.

fields.name: mirahDomain
fields.description:
This is not part of the standard FHIR specification and is an extension.
A human readable description of the "domain" of this item. The domain is akin to a family
of questionnaires. For example, there are many versions of the SDQ, each of which is its own
administrable questionnaire, but the same questions are used under the hood. In this case,
  the questions are grouped in a domain and reused between assessments.

fields.name: mirahShortname
fields.description:
This is not part of the standard FHIR specification and is an extension.
A human readable description of this item, unique to the domain it is in.

fields.name: questionType
fields.description: The item's type.

fields.name: questionnaires
fields.description: The questionnaires this item is a part of

fields.name: text
fields.description: The item's main text

types.name: QuestionnaireItemType
types.description:
The type of this item. This is indicative only as the specification does not allow for enough distinction, and
will not show the exact way the question is displayed.
Based on https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-item-type.html
Also has a 'custom' field for types which are too complicated to represent in FHIR.

enumValues.name: DISPLAY
enumValues.description: Purely display and does not support answering

enumValues.name: TEXT
enumValues.description: A longer or essay text response

enumValues.name: OPENCHOICE
enumValues.description: A set of choices with a write-in answer

enumValues.name: INTEGER
enumValues.description: An input that will output an integer number

enumValues.name: DATE
enumValues.description: An input that will output a date

enumValues.name: CUSTOM
enumValues.description: Custom questions too complicated to be expressed in FHIR

types.name: QuestionnaireResponse
types.description:
Questionnaire Responses as defined at https://www.hl7.org/fhir/questionnaireresponse.html correspond to
a filled-out set of answers by a given user for a given questionnaire. Note that in the Mirah system
a questionnaire can have sub-questionnaires, but only the response of the top level questionnaire is
recorded here. This may change in future.

fields.name: diagnosticReport
fields.description: The diagnostic report this questionnaire response is part of

fields.name: observations
fields.description: Observations taken as part of the response

fields.name: questionnaire
fields.description: The questionnaire being answered

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this report

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: QuestionnaireResponseItem
types.description:
Questionnaire Response Items are the individual answers for a questionnaire response, i.e. an answer chosen
by a particular user for a particular question on a particular questionnaire

fields.name: diagnosticReport
fields.description: The diagnostic report this answer is part of

fields.name: observations
fields.description: The observations this answer is part of

fields.name: questionnaireItem
fields.description: The question this item is answering

fields.name: questionnaireResponses
fields.description:
The primary questionnaire response that this answer is part of. Note that due to the way we handle
subscales, it may be the case that actually this item was used to score more than one item. You should
access that through Observation instead. This may be null if it was only used in a subscale.

fields.name: value
fields.description: All answers in the system are strings. They may be coerced into different types for the purpose of scoring etc.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: String
types.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: message
fields.description: A description of the error

fields.name: path
fields.description: Which input value this error came from

types.name: Uuid
types.description: A unique object identifier as defined by https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4122.txt

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
